titleInfo.title: USA v. Stanko
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 55 Motion for Transcripts as to Rudolph George Stanko. Upon the receipt of a deposit of $72.60, transcripts of the three hearings will be ordered. Should the cost of the transcripts exceed this amount, the defendant will be required to pay the difference. Likewise, should the cost of the transcript be less than $72.60, the Clerk shall issue a refund check. The Clerk shall immediately notify the chambers of the undersigned when the $72.60 deposit is received. Upon receipt the said funds, the Clerk is ordered to prepare a transcript of the hearings held on March 14, 2005, March 17, 2005 and March 23, 2005. Signed by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett on 8/1/2005. (MLF, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Stanko
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER regarding Request for Transcript 69 as to defendant Rudolph George Stanko. The defendant is ordered to put on file with the Clerk of the US District Court a check in the amount of $36.30. Should the cost of the transcript exceed this amount, the defendant will be required to pay the difference. Likewise, should the cost of the transcript be less than $36.30, the Clerk shall issue a refund check. Upon receipt the said funds, the Clerk is ordered to prepare a transcript of the hearing held on October 13, 2005. A copy of the transcript shall be mailed to the defendant. Signed by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett on 11/14/2005. (MLF, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Stanko
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Rudolph George Stanko (1): Defendant was found guilty on Counts I and II of the Second Superseding Indictment and is committed to the Bureau of Prisons for a term of 72 months on counts I and II, to run concurrent; 3 years supervised release with special conditions to run concurrent; $200.00 special assessment; $5,143.63 jury costs. The defendant was found not guilty on Count III of the Second Superseding Indictment. The Indictment and Seperseding Indictment are dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this defendant only, as to defendant Rudolph George Stanko. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. 4 certified copies USM. (JAE, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to Rudolph George Stanko (1): Defendant was found guilty on Counts I and II of the Second Superseding Indictment and is committed to the Bureau of Prisons for a term of 72 months on counts I and II, to run concurrent; 3 years supervised release with special conditions to run concurrent; $200.00 special assessment; $5,143.63 jury costs. The defendant was found not guilty on Count III of the Second Superseding Indictment. The Indictment and Seperseding Indictment are dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this defendant only, as to defendant Rudolph George Stanko. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. 4 certified copies USM. (JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Stanko
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - This matter is before the court on defendant's notice of appeal and request to proceed on appeal in forma pauperis 295. Defendant has represented to the court under oath in his current criminal case, United States v. Stanko, 06CR50, that he is impoverished and has no assets to represent himself. Accordingly, the court grants his request to file his appeal in forma pauperis in this case. Additionally, the clerk of court is instructed to submit Filing Nos. 296 and 299 to the Eighth Circuit. THEREFORE, IT IS ORDERED that defendant's motion to proceed in forma pauperis on appeal 295 is granted as to Rudolph George Stanko. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon (KBJ) Modified on 8/21/2006 to correct the filing date (KBJ).

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER - This matter is before the court on defendant's notice of appeal and request to proceed on appeal in forma pauperis 295. Defendant has represented to the court under oath in his current criminal case, United States v. Stanko, 06CR50, that he is impoverished and has no assets to represent himself. Accordingly, the court grants his request to file his appeal in forma pauperis in this case. Additionally, the clerk of court is instructed to submit Filing Nos. 296 and 299 to the Eighth Circuit. THEREFORE, IT IS ORDERED that defendant's motion to proceed in forma pauperis on appeal 295 is granted as to Rudolph George Stanko. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon (KBJ) Modified on 8/21/2006 to correct the filing date (KBJ).

titleInfo.title: USA v. Stanko
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER as to defendant Rudolph George Stanko (1). 1. Stanko's Objection (filing no. 423; Case No. 8:10CV151, Filing No. 12) is granted to the extent that the court will not treat Stanko's April 19, 2010, filing as a motion filed pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 2255. 2. The Clerk of the court is directed to re-assign Case No. 8:10CV151 to the pro se docket. However, the case may remain assigned to the undersigned judge because it is related to this matter. The Clerk of the court is also directed to refer all motions in Case No. 8:10CV151 to the pro se docket. 3. The Clerk of the court is directed to file all pleadings previously filed in Case No. 8:10CV151, filed as Filing No. 419 in this matter, in Case No. 8:10CV151. To the extent it remains pending, Filing No. 419 is therefore denied as moot. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copy mailed to pro se party) (JAB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Stanko
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER as to defendant Rudolph George Stanko. Defendant's motion for modification of his sentence to delete criminal history points, Filing No. 428, and motion to expedite the motion, Filing No. 433, are denied. Defendant's motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis, Filing No. 431, is granted. Defendant's Motion to Vacate under 28 U.S.C. § 2255, Filing No. 430, is denied. Defendant's Petition for Certificate of Appealability, Filing No. 434, is denied. The Clerk of Court is ordered to send a copy of the Petition for Certificate of Appealabilty, Filing No. 434, to the Eighth Circuit Court of Appeals. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copy mailed/e-mailed to pro se party and to the Circuit as directed)(GJG) Civil Case 8:10-cv-00432-JFB closed.
